It is an investment in conducting clinical research that contributes to the effectiveness, quality, equity, end, efficiency of pediatric surgical care and outcomes in BC. Reporting to the Executive Director, OPSEI is looking for an independent and motivated individual to assist in various projects which aim to improve clinical care. The Co-Op Student will provide support on both discrete short-term projects and longer-term initiatives. The successful candidate will be required to work as part of a project team, or may work quite independently. Some of the projects or duties that this position is responsible include: • Gathering, collating and submitting Quality Improvement data on a monthly basis on a variety of clinical studies. • Communicate and collaborate with various pediatric surgeons and their teams on clinical research and QI projects. • Support and initiate new research projects under the direction of the Director and Surgical Faculty including, literature reviews, protocol development, ethics approval, patient and family recruitment, study analysis, and formal presentation of results.
